Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; Table of Contents TABLE OF CONTENTS &#160; ITEM 5.04&#160;&#160;TEMPORARY SUSPENSION OF TRADING UNDER REGISTRANT&#8217;S EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS. 3 &#160; &#160; SIGNATURES 4 Table of Contents ITEM&#160;5.04.&#160;&#160;TEMPORARY SUSPENSION OF TRADING UNDER REGISTRANT&#8217;S EMPLOYEE BENEFIT PLANS. On November 15, 2019, Amazon.com, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) notified participants in the Amazon.com, Inc. 401(k) Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;) that Fidelity Investments (&#8220;Fidelity&#8221;) had been selected as the new recordkeeper for the Plan. In order to properly account for assets and to transfer records as accurately as possible in connection with the transition to Fidelity, Plan account activity will be restricted such that Plan participants will not be able to make exchanges or asset allocation changes, take a loan, or request a withdrawal or distribution for a specified period of time (the &#8220;Blackout Period&#8221;). The Blackout Period is expected to begin on January 2, 2020 and end the week of January 12, 2020. Plan participants can find out whether the Blackout Period has started or ended by contacting Fidelity at 1-800-835-5095 during the Blackout Period and for up to two years after the end of the Blackout Period. On November 19, 2019, the Company provided written notice to its Section 16 officers and directors pursuant to Section 306(a)(6) of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and Rule 104 of Securities and Exchange Commission Regulation BTR. This notice stated that during the Blackout Period the Section 16 officers and directors will be subject to trading restrictions relating to any equity securities (including derivative securities) of the Company acquired in connection with their employment or service as a Section 16 officer or director. 3 Table of Contents SIGNATURES Pursuant to the requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, the registrant has duly caused this report to be signed on its behalf by the undersigned hereunto duly authorized. &#160; &#160; AMAZON.COM, INC. (REGISTRANT) &#160; &#160; &#160; &#160; By: /s/ David A. Zapolsky &#160; &#160; David A. Zapolsky &#160; &#160; Senior Vice President Dated: November 19, 2019 4
